headline: Palantir (NASDAQ:PLTR) Beats Expectations in Strong Q2, Guides for Strong Full-Year Sales
summary: Data-mining and analytics company Palantir (NYSE:PLTR) reported revenue ahead of Wall Street’s expectations in Q2 CY2025, with sales up 48% year on year to $1.00 billion. On top of that, next quarter’s revenue guidance ($1.09 billion at the midpoint) was surprisingly good and 10.5% above what analysts were expecting. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.16 per share was 15.6% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Apple CEO Tells Staff AI 'Ours to Grab'
summary: Apple Inc. Chief Executive Officer Tim Cook, holding a rare all-hands meeting following earnings results, rallied employees around the company's artificial intelligence prospects and an "amazing" pipeline of products. The executive gathered staff at Apple's on-campus auditorium Friday in Cupertino, California, telling them that the AI revolution is "as big or bigger" as the internet, smartphones, cloud computing and apps. "Apple must do this. Apple will do this. This is sort of ours to grab," Cook told employees, according to people aware of the meeting. "We will make the investment to do it." The iPhone maker has been late to AI, debuting Apple Intelligence months after OpenAI, Alphabet Inc.'s Google, Microsoft Corp. and others flooded the market with products like ChatGPT. And when Apple finally released its AI tools, they fell flat. Bloomberg's Mark Gurman reports.

raw.headline: Apple CEO Tells Staff AI 'Ours to Grab'
raw.summary: Apple Inc. Chief Executive Officer Tim Cook, holding a rare all-hands meeting following earnings results, rallied employees around the company's artificial intelligence prospects and an "amazing" pipeline of products. The executive gathered staff at Apple's on-campus auditorium Friday in Cupertino, California, telling them that the AI revolution is "as big or bigger" as the internet, smartphones, cloud computing and apps. "Apple must do this. Apple will do this. This is sort of ours to grab," Cook told employees, according to people aware of the meeting. "We will make the investment to do it." The iPhone maker has been late to AI, debuting Apple Intelligence months after OpenAI, Alphabet Inc.'s Google, Microsoft Corp. and others flooded the market with products like ChatGPT. And when Apple finally released its AI tools, they fell flat. Bloomberg's Mark Gurman reports.

headline: Figma sheds $11 billion in market value days after blockbuster IPO
summary: NEW YORK (Reuters) -Shares of Figma slumped 23% on profit taking on Monday, as euphoria over the design software firm waned days after its blockbuster initial public offering.  San Francisco, California-based Figma shares had scored a massive 250% gain during their market debut on Thursday when they were priced at $33 but finished at $115.50, giving the company a market capitalization of about $56.3 billion.  Figma's market value closed at $59.5 billion on Friday after its shares rose 5.6% to $122.

raw.headline: Figma sheds $11 billion in market value days after blockbuster IPO
raw.summary: NEW YORK (Reuters) -Shares of Figma slumped 23% on profit taking on Monday, as euphoria over the design software firm waned days after its blockbuster initial public offering.  San Francisco, California-based Figma shares had scored a massive 250% gain during their market debut on Thursday when they were priced at $33 but finished at $115.50, giving the company a market capitalization of about $56.3 billion.  Figma's market value closed at $59.5 billion on Friday after its shares rose 5.6% to $122.

headline: Cash Windfall From Trump’s Tax Law Is Starting to Show Up at Big Companies
summary: The magnitude of the cash savings from this summer’s federal tax legislation is starting to take shape at America’s biggest companies.  AT&T  recently said it expected $1.5 billion to $2 billion in cash tax savings this year, due to provisions in the tax-and-spending law dubbed the One Big Beautiful Bill Act.  The high end of the range is equivalent to an 11% boost to analyst estimates of 2025 free cash flow before the law was enacted.

raw.headline: Cash Windfall From Trump’s Tax Law Is Starting to Show Up at Big Companies

The high end of the range is equivalent to an 11% boost to analyst estimates of 2025 free cash flow before the law was enacted.
